{"step_by_step_thinking": "The effectiveness of epidural analgesia for labor can vary from woman to woman. There are several factors that can influence the effectiveness of epidural analgesia, such as the dosage and concentration of the medication used, the skill and experience of the anesthesiologist administering the epidural, the individual woman's response to the medication, and any anatomical variations that may affect the spread of the medication. Additionally, some women may experience incomplete pain relief or side effects from epidural analgesia. Therefore, it is not guaranteed that the standard of effective analgesia is reachable in all women.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
